turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about GMC V6 engine.
turn.1: What was the GMC V6 engine?
turn.2: GMC V6 engine GMC Truck produced a unique 60 degree V6 engine family from 1959 through 1974, in gasoline and Diesel versions.
turn.3: What else did you find interesting?
turn.4: V8 and V12 derivatives of the basic design were also produced.
turn.6: Examples of this engine family were found in pickup trucks, Suburbans, heavier trucks and motor coaches.
turn.8: V6 engines were produced in 305, 351, 401 and 478 cubic-inch (5.0, 5.8, 6.6, and 7.8 respectively liter) displacements, with considerable parts commonality.
turn.10: During the latter years of production, versions with enlarged crankshaft journals were manufactured as well.
turn.11: What other cam shafts did they have?
turn.12: GMC produced a 60° V8 with a single cam shaft using the same general layout (bore and stroke) as the 478 V6.
